headline: NIKON MODEL 6
description: Comparison Microscope    Specifically designed for comparative inspection   and measurement of IC and LSI masks. Offers excellent  reproduction, accurate measurement, and simple operation.    AS IS, WHERE IS
specstable:
Manufacturer Nikon
Model Model 6
Description Comparison Microscope
Accessories
  • Nikon DP-212 Digital Printer
  • Nikon LPS-C-1A Lamp Power Supply
  • Nikon Camera Controller
  • Nikon ERC-M-252 Reversible Counter
  • 6 paired sets of mask holders: 3" x 3", 3.5" x 3.5", 4 "x 4", 4.5" x 4.5", 5" x 5", 6" x 6"
Other Information

Microscope type: inverted
Microscope configuration: brightfield
Illumination type: reflected light
Binocular angle: 45°
Trinocular/phototube provided
Magnification changer: 200X, 400X, 800X
Multiple objectives: 10.5mm f/0.79, N.A. = 0.7, 40X magnifying power
Illumination power: Volts: 24, Watts: 150
Stage type: Coaxial X-Y
Stage travel: X: 127mm, Y: 127mm
Camera type: Polaroid 4x5

This piece functions by using two objectives to capture, and then superimpose two separate images, one of the original mask and one of the working mask.
The ability to then measure and compare both images is enhanced by the following system features:

  • One-touch changeover switch for coarse and fine movement of the large stage
  • Excellent image resolution owing to bright illumination and top-quality Nikon optics.
  • Observation wavelengths of 546.1 and 632.8 nanometers
  • Digital display of image position and movement
  • 200X, 400X, and 800X magnification (with 1.05mm, 0.25mm, and 0.28mm FOVs)
  • +/- 0.1mm focusing adjustment range and +/-2.5 deg. rotation adjustment range
  • Ability to produce 3.25" x 4.25" Polaroids of up to 400X magnification

Condition Excellent
Exterior Dimensions
Width 26.000 in (66.0 cm)
Depth 35.000 in (88.9 cm)
Height 28.000 in (71.1 cm)
Weight 660 lb (299 kg)
